name: 2-aminopropane
source: Dreisbach R. R. Physical Properties of Chemical Compounds; Vol. III; American Chemical Society; Washington; 1961.
Reason: 2-Aminopropane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The presence of an amino group can increase the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10 degrees Celsius.
